template.name: Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP
template.description:
This is a template for Cisco UCS Manager monitoring via Zabbix SNMP Agent that works without any external scripts.
MIBs used: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-EQUIPMENT-MIB IF-MIB HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-PROCESSOR-MIB CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/418396-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-templates-for-cisco
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.name[sysName.0],#1)<>last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.name[sysName.0],#2) and length(last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.name[sysName.0]))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time in seconds since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining 'what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor 'Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its 'Fred Router'.

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_CACHE_LOCATION}: Disk array cache controller battery status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_CACHE_LOCATION}: Disk array cache controller battery is in critical state!
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_CACHE_LOCATION}: Disk array cache controller battery is not in optimal state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: {#DISKARRAY_CACHE_LOCATION}: Disk array cache controller battery is in critical state!

item_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller model
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB

item_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:RaidBattery:operability managed object property.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is not in optimal state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: {#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state
{#DISKARRAY_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in warning state

item_prototype.name: {#FAN_LOCATION}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-EQUIPMENT-MIB Cisco UCS equipment:Fan:operState managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#FAN_LOCATION}: Fan is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the fan unit

trigger_prototype.name: {#FAN_LOCATION}: Fan is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the fan unit

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface description
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Broadcast packets received
item_prototype.description:
MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInBroadcastPkts.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Multicast packets received
item_prototype.description:
MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInMulticastPkts.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Broadcast packets sent
item_prototype.description:
MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutBroadcastPkts.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Multicast packets sent
item_prototype.description:
MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutMulticastPkts.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate on {#IFNAME}
trigger_prototype.event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate on {#IFNAME} ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Recovers when value below {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

discovery_rule.name: Physical disk discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of physical drive entries CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB::cucsStorageLocalDiskTable.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk media type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalDisk:deviceType managed object property. Actually returns 'HDD' or 'SSD'.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalDisk:model managed object property.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalDisk:serial managed object property. Actually returns part number code.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cucsStorageLocalDiskSerial.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cucsStorageLocalDiskSerial.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cucsStorageLocalDiskSerial.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Disk serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk size
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalDisk:size managed object property. In MB.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalDisk:diskState managed object property.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.physicaldisk.status[cucsStorageLocalDiskDiskState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.CRIT:"bad"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.physicaldisk.status[cucsStorageLocalDiskDiskState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.CRIT:"predictiveFailure"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk error
trigger_prototype.description: Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

item_prototype.name: {#PSU_LOCATION}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-EQUIPMENT-MIB Cisco UCS equipment:Psu:operState managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#PSU_LOCATION}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

trigger_prototype.name: {#PSU_LOCATION}: Power supply is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

dependency.name: {#PSU_LOCATION}: Power supply is in critical state

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-PROCESSOR-MIB Cisco UCS processor:EnvStats:temperature managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.IOH: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Cisco UCS compute:RackUnitMbTempStats:ioh1Temp managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.IOH: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.IOH: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Ambient: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Ambient

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Ambient: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Ambient: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Front: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Cisco UCS compute:RackUnitMbTempStats:frontTemp managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Front: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Front: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Rear: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Cisco UCS compute:RackUnitMbTempStats:rearTemp managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Rear: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_LOCATION}.Rear: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: Hardware model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Cisco UCS compute:RackUnit:model managed object property

item_prototype.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: Hardware serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Cisco UCS compute:RackUnit:serial managed object property

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.serialnumber[cucsComputeRackUnitSerial.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.serialnumber[cucsComputeRackUnitSerial.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.serialnumber[cucsComputeRackUnitSerial.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: Device has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: Overall system health status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-COMPUTE-MIB Cisco UCS compute:RackUnit:operState managed object property

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"computeFailed"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"configFailure"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"unconfigFailure"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"inoperable"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: System status is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for errors

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.WARN:"testFailed"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.WARN:"thermalProblem"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.WARN:"powerProblem"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.WARN:"voltageProblem"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.WARN:"diagnosticsFailed"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: System status is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings

dependency.name: {#UNIT_LOCATION}: System status is in critical state
dependency.expression: last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"computeFailed"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"configFailure"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"unconfigFailure"} or last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.status[cucsComputeRackUnitOperState.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$HEALTH.STATUS.CRIT:"inoperable"}

item_prototype.name: {#VDISK_LOCATION}: Layout type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalLun:type managed object property

item_prototype.name: {#VDISK_LOCATION}: Disk size
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalLun:size managed object property in MB.

item_prototype.name: {#VDISK_LOCATION}: Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-UNIFIED-COMPUTING-STORAGE-MIB Cisco UCS storage:LocalLun:presence managed object property

trigger_prototype.name: {#VDISK_LOCATION}: Virtual disk is not in OK state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check virtual disk for warnings or errors

macro.description: The cache battery critical state for trigger expression.
The cache battery normal state for trigger expression.

The unit health critical state for trigger expression.
The unit health critical state for trigger expression.
The unit health critical state for trigger expression.

The unit health warning state for trigger expression.

The unit health warning state for trigger expression.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level. Ignore notPresent(6) by default.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level. Ignore down(2) administrative status by default.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host level. Filter out loopbacks, sup-fc0, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default.

The vdisk normal state for trigger expression.

trigger.expression: (last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/Cisco UCS Manager by SNMP/cisco.ucs.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Host has been restarted
